minesweeper

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • minesweeper.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    ADT that represents minesweeper board

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(java.io.File file)
      Constructs the same board as in the file, specified by the following grammar * FILE ::= BOARD LINE+ BOARD ::= X SPACE Y NEWLINE LINE ::= (VAL SPACE)* VAL NEWLINE VAL ::= 0 | 1 X ::= INT Y ::= INT SPACE ::= " " NEWLINE ::= "\n" | "\r" "\n"?
      Board(int x, int y)
      Constructs a new random board with x columns and y rows

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int columnsNumber()
      returns number of columns on the board
      void deflagIfFlagged(int x, int y)
      Deflags cell (x,y) if it was flagged
      boolean digIfUntouched(int x, int y)
      Digs cell (x,y) if it is untouched, updates the number of neighbor bombs of this cell, if cell contains a bomb, makes this cell empty and updates dug empty neighbor cells digs its neighbors if neighbor bombs number is zero if was touched - does nothing
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object that)
      Two boards are equal if and only if the sizes are the same each cell is in the same state and either contains a bomb or not
      void flagIfUntouched(int x, int y)
      Flags cell (x,y) if it was untouched
      int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code.
      boolean isDug(int x, int y)
      Observe whether cell (x,y) is dug
      boolean isFlagged(int x, int y)
      Observe whether cell (x,y) is flagged
      boolean isUntouched(int x, int y)
      Observe whether cell (x,y) is touched (not flagged and not dug)
      int neighborBombs(int x, int y)
      Finds number of adjacent bombs to dug empty cell (x,y)
      int rowsNumber()
      returns number of rows on the board
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of a board X direction is horizontal, Y is vertical each row starts from new line (separated by "\n" character) within a line cells are separated by space character each cell is represented by one character "-" if untouched "F" if flagged " " if dug and neighbor cells do not contain bombs 1-8 number of neighbor bombs otherwise

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(java.io.File file)
      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Constructs the same board as in the file, specified by the following grammar * 
           FILE ::= BOARD LINE+
   BOARD ::= X SPACE Y NEWLINE
   LINE ::= (VAL SPACE)* VAL NEWLINE
   VAL ::= 0 | 1
   X ::= INT
   Y ::= INT
   SPACE ::= " "
   NEWLINE ::= "\n" | "\r" "\n"?
   INT ::= [0-9]+
        Parameters:
        file - file where board stores
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file was not found

      • Board

        public Board(int x,
             int y)
        Constructs a new random board with x columns and y rows
        Parameters:
        x - number of columns, x > 0
        y - number of rows, y > 0

    • Method Detail

      • columnsNumber

        public int columnsNumber()
        returns number of columns on the board

        public int rowsNumber()
        returns number of rows on the board

        public boolean isUntouched(int x,
                           int y)
        Observe whether cell (x,y) is touched (not flagged and not dug)
        Parameters:
        x - 0 <= x < columnsNumber
        y - 0 <= y < rowsNumber
        Returns:
        true if and only if cell (x,y) is untouched

                     int y)

        y - 0 <= y < rowsNumber
        Returns:

      • neighborBombs

        public int neighborBombs(int x,
                         int y)
                  throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Finds number of adjacent bombs to dug empty cell (x,y)
        Parameters:
        x - 0 <= x < columnsNumber
        y - 0 <= y < rowsNumber
        Returns:
        number of adjacent bombs to cell (x,y)
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if cell (x,y) is not dug or contains a bomb

      • digIfUntouched

        public boolean digIfUntouched(int x,
                              int y)
        Digs cell (x,y) if it is untouched, updates the number of neighbor bombs of this cell, if cell contains a bomb, makes this cell empty and updates dug empty neighbor cells digs its neighbors if neighbor bombs number is zero if was touched - does nothing
        Parameters:
        x - 0 <= x < columnsNumber
        y - 0 <= y < rowsNumber
        Returns:
        true if and only if cell was dug and contained a bomb

      • flagIfUntouched

        public void flagIfUntouched(int x,
                            int y)
        Flags cell (x,y) if it was untouched
        Parameters:
        x - 0 <= x < columnsNumber
        y - 0 <= y < rowsNumber

      • deflagIfFlagged

        public void deflagIfFlagged(int x,
                            int y)
        Deflags cell (x,y) if it was flagged
        Parameters:
        x - 0 <= x < columnsNumber
        y - 0 <= y < rowsNumber

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object that)
        Two boards are equal if and only if the sizes are the same each cell is in the same state and either contains a bomb or not
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code. Consistent with equals
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of a board X direction is horizontal, Y is vertical each row starts from new line (separated by "\n" character) within a line cells are separated by space character each cell is represented by one character "-" if untouched "F" if flagged " " if dug and neighbor cells do not contain bombs 1-8 number of neighbor bombs otherwise
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
